values:
are you there, universal do-gooding loveforce?  it's me, rylielou.

i have a few requests which you can go ahead and see to, you know, immediately.

first things first, i've had a hangover for like a week now, could you take care of that for me?  

"BUT LITTLE RYLIE!!! YOU GAVE YOURSELF THE WEEKLONG HANGOVER, NOT THE U.D-G.L-F.  THAT'S NOT OUR STYLE, YOU KNOW!!!"

uh, i never used to get hangovers, and i'm not even drinking that much... what's the deal, dude?

"LET'S BE HONEST HERE, LITTLEBEAR!!! YOU ARE SO DRINKING THAT MUCH!!! YOU KNOW BETTER, AND WE HAVE BEEN SENDING LIVER-ANGELS AND KIDNEY-SPRITES TO YOU TO GENTLY REMIND YOU TO TREAT YOUR BODY RIGHT!!!"

gimme a break, i have a headach--

"DON'T YOU PLAY DUMB, DEARONE!!!  DON'T YOU FUCK WITH US!!!"

....okay.  i'm pickin up what you're puttin down.

dear livejournal, 
 
long time no see.  i'm just gonna dive right in. 

this week has been an eventful one.  the great-looking man with an awful attitude that i've been dating for the past three months finally initiated a conversation that quickly lead to a mutual, friendly breakup.  after we talked, we just hugged and hugged and that was the nicest we've been to one another for a few weeks.  while we were breaking up, jeff put on a phillip glass album, which included a beautiful song that i had listened to on repeat during my break up with eric.  synchronicity, you will never fail to amaze me.  

i moved!  my new house has a composting toilet.   being a squeamish-type, i am having a difficult time adjusting (meaning, i hold it).  the boys (meaning, boys) that lived there before me are sweethearts, but slobs, so i've spent a lot of time cleaning up the house and getting it "lady-dized."  i keep saying that word to myself as i scrub the shower, paint the walls, collect empty whiskey bottles... "gotta git dis place lady-dized!!  yes-yes!"

my little sister came to visit me.   friends told us we act like we're from the south, like we're SOUTHERN BELLES.  it is a compliment, but it's also puzzling, because i feel like we're both kinda grubby and goofy, we sit with our legs sprawled all over and we say words like "fucken" and "asshole."  anyhow.  we cooked together and sat on a log by the water, watching waterbirds and boats.  we put on essential oils (marla prefers cedar right now, and fennel is my favorite) and did egyhop (the emma goldman youth and homeless outreach program).  it was good times.  

my backpack got stolen.  i have to replace my i.d., my bank card, my cell phone, all the numbers that were on my cell phone, a whole stack of cds, etc etc.  i have already replaced the backpack and a wallet, both purchased last night at the goodwill for a DOLLAR EACH.  easy come, easy go.  

bonny "prince" billy and juana molina are both playing shows soon.  they are both on my ultimate all time favorite list,  and i want to be there to see them each, but i am broke!  then again, i don't want finances to keep me from living my life!   but really, i need to pay rent!  circles and loops and little tiny infinities go around in my head all day long.  i wish i were the kind of person who knew how to be DECISIVE!  and CERTAIN!  and ACTION-ORIENTED!  me, i'll just think about things and let them stew for ever until the opportunity has passed and all that consideration becomes a waste of time.  and i drive myself crazy doing it... but this, but that, but this...

anyhow, livejournal, i've missed you.  it's time for me to head out into the chilly saturday night...

today olympia feels and looks like my beloved flagstaff.  it is snowy and sunny.  it has been for quite awhile now, thank the sweet lord, and the break from all the rain and grey has inspired me to go on long meandering walks that get me contentedly lost.  and, oh what joy, i have been able to ride my bike around.  i have become car dependent, just as i feared i would.  i found myself going off on my usual "what the fuck is the point of putting anti-war or environmental bumper stickers on a gas-guzzling, carbon-producing car?" rant, but this time i was driving while i was ranting.  it only occurred to me what a hypocrite it made me several blocks down the road.  a few days ago, my car done broke down and will cost hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of dollars to fix.  i think  was the universe helping me to get back on rylie's happy track.  the car was bad for me financially, morally and physically (i have gained about 15 pounds since leaving flagstaff, most of which i attribute to anxiety-driven compulsive eating, but the car certainly hasn't helped).    it's easy to be excited about being a biker/pedestrian again, but when the weather gets rainy again, i'm sure i'll be complaining like a wee baby crashing off of a sugar high.  

still no job.  i'm really freaking out about it but i won't talk about it here because i'm trying to relax!

hilary and i have settled into the house and it's becoming more comfortable by the day.  she is a very talented artist, so our walls are covered in a mix of her prints and my random collection of weird art.  our living room is warmed by the fireplace, lit by huge windows in the daytime and chinese lanterns at night.  we live off of our version of papusas, beans and cheese melted between corn tortillas.  we have this wonderful philosophical energy bouncing around.  we are studying order vs. chaos, a strange culmination of many things, mostly my current interest in buddhism and her interest in fractal math.  i practice walking meditation and she is producing wonderful art.  it's exciting and wonderful to be able to share ideas with her.  

i met a boy who i was starting to like quite a bit, but he never calls me back so, again, it must be the universe giving me a hint that it wasn't meant to be.  that's a hippy way of saying the dude is lame and i'm waiting for something better to come along.  it is disappointing, though.  so far both of the people that i have met and befriended on my own have crapped out.  it's HARD for me to meet people, so it sucks that i can't seem to keep them around.  

i'm terribly homesick.

welly, i made it.  years of talkin' and whinin' and dreamin' about it, i'm finally sittin' in a coffee shop sippin' on a latte in muthafuckin' olympia washington.  it feels just like flagstaff to me, which is nice because i love flagstaff.  my friend hilary and i found a beautiful old house to live in.  i'm really excited about it.  it has an old piano it it, and a fireplace and the livingroom windows look out over budd bay and the interstate.  kool.  

i need a job.  i've applied all over the place, but no callbacks.  i need some friends.  we went out to bars and a party the other night but i didn't meet anyone i think i could become friends with.  i need to go to evergreen university.  they have a program where you learn how to sail.  oh baby.  i need to make out with beautiful olympia people.  they are everywhere, and they're on bikes.  

i'm getting more and more homesick everyday, but i'm also getting more excited to be here as i explore and get comfortable with the place.  it's going to be good.  you can only see it on clear days, but mt. rainier is like twenty san fransisco peaks all stacked up.  i got goosebumps the first time i saw it.  breathtaking.

when i am so depressed that i resort to reading self-help books, because it's either the books or waiting on the train tracks to smashed up to bits, i re-read the part that says how important self dialog is.   other people can compliment me, but it doesn't matter because i have absolutely nothing kind to say about myself.  i could list off all the terrible things that run through my head every day, but it would just make me sound really creepy so i won't.  anyway.  the books suggest forcing yourself to say nice things out loud, even if you don't believe it.  you have to look at yourself in the mirror right in the eye and say things like "you are a good person"  or "you are worthy of love" or "your have value in this world."  if you say it enough times, it maybe doesn't sound like an out-right lie.  after you reach that point, keep saying it and it starts to sound almost plausible.  after that, you might even begin to feel it's the absolute, constant and infinite truth.  i'm at the stage where i can almost look myself in the eye without crying.  

related but much different:  i have realized i depend on other people, specifically people that i'm in romantic relationships with, to supply me with self-esteem.  once the thrill of a new love has started to wear off, the relationship feels shallow and superficial because after a certain point relationships need to evolve into something a little deeper than sexual attraction and it's at that point that all of my relationships have failed.  the thrill part makes me feel beautiful, interesting, desirable... for a few weeks, or months... when i realize that actually, i DON'T think i'm beautiful, i DON'T think i'm interesting, i DON'T think i'm anything like that, well, what's the point of being in a relationship?  what do i have to offer?  i'm boycotting "dating" and all that junk for awhile, until i'm at the point where if someone says i'm beautiful i respond with "yeah, i know!" or if someone says they love me, i can shout at top volume "I LOVE ME, TOO!"  

so besides hating my life and myself, i also hate: 
--my cat.  i'm giving her to the purina factory when i move (which is in one month!).
--my job.  i quit one and i can't wait to quit the other one.
--how my parents have no faith in me.
--cars.  i have to breathe in their nasty fumes when i ride my bike, trying to do a good thing.  trying to be a goddamn good citizen.  not to mention they almost run me down all the time.
--shitty friends.  being one and having them.
--knowing i will work my fingers to the bone until the day i die and will always be living in poverty.  having a portion of my hard-earned money go to support the war (TWO BILLION DOLLARS IS SPENT ON THE AMERICAN WAR MACHINE EVERY SINGLE WEEK.  oh my fucking god.).  being a cog in the wheel.  feeling hopeless to change my position.  knowing the majority of the world's population feels this way.
--how males spread hpv (and other stds) around like it's no big deal while my friend gets to go have a surgery so she doesn't die because some dumb dickhead gave it to her.
--bug bites
--fake smiles.  maybe more than anything else, i hate fake smiles. 

that's it for the happyryliesunshinehour.  it's really not as bad as i make it out to be, or maybe it is but that's okay too.

so.  i have had two baking jobs for a few months now, and even though i LOVE baking, doing two jobs that are so similar is making me nuts.  i feel like a robot.  like the oven is one machine, the mixer is a machine and i'm just another machine.  just nuts and bolts and a little electricity that can automatically make you whatever pastry you desire.  it's really bizarre.   all my hard work is going to pay off soon, though.  i'm treating myself to a trip to san fransisco at the end of the month, and then at the end of august i think i'm going to drive to olympia with my friend who's moving there.  if i love it as much as i think i will, i can probably afford to move there a month or two later.  i feel really optimistic and excited about what i'm doing with my life. 

the other day i was reading mary sojourner.  she writes about flagstaff and northern arizona in such a way that makes my heart ache.  i will miss this beautiful place... i will miss my coffeeshop, and the painted desert.  i will miss sedona and my neighborhood.  i will miss having my best friend and family so close by.  but i'm going to thrive in the pacific northwest, i can feel it.

the other day a friend and i decided we wanted a picnic.  we made food, stopped to fill ourselves with coffee and then biked out to buffalo park.  on the way is about a mile incline, and on that uphill mile the sky decided to open up and cold heavy rain poured down on us.  the rain gods decided that wasn't quite enough so they threw in some fairly good-sized hail as well.  we got to the park completly drenched and found shelter.  we ate our vegan feast and watched the clouds move past and as soon as it was clear we rode back to town.  bertoni, my sweet ride, LOVES going downhill.  i coasted along and watched the little stream that was rushing in the gutter beside me and in that moment, 
the stream and bertoni and sunlight and the magestic all connected with me.  for that moment, we were one and i didn't feel alone.  there were deer in the trees around me, and ravens circling in the grey sky and my darling friend coasting behind me... but that isn't what made me feel un-alone.  it was one of those rare hightened awareness deals. magic!!!

this darling friend of mine loves my body and cares about it and takes care of it... but he doesn't know (or seem to care to know) any other part of me at all.  usually this would not be okay with me.  but something about the timing being right and this friend of mine not fitting all the things i want from a partner but still being a good person does make it okay.  for now. 

i'm going home now and i'm going to finish folding laundry and doing dishes and i'm going to make myself some tea and maybe a salad and then i'm going to listen to records until i fall asleep or hillary calls me to go out, either one.

I PURCHASED MY VERY FIRST BIKE TODAY!   it's italian and teeny and i am in love with it.  bellisima! 

a new gentleman has been escorting me through my early-summer late-night wanderings and i really really like him.  i said to myself "SELF!  take some time!  be alone (but secure and comfortable in that alone-ness), be real nice to yourself and do some soul-searching for awhile!  self-love is good love!"  but then he had to be all KIND AND CHARMING AND INTERESTED IN ME so what could i do?  we're both cautious and shy so at least we're not rushing into anything that i can't handle... 

i can't get a certain image out of my head.  it's a bunch of fish sleeping, snuggled down In sleeping bags on the dark murky bottom of a lake.  it's HILARIOUS to me and makes me smile tons.  because, don't you know, fish don't really sleep.  they never close their eyes.  isn't that MIND BOGGLING?!?  

this year marks the eighth anniversary for me and my vegetarianism.  we're good old pals by now and i'm going to celebrate it by speeding on home, making myself some eggplant punjab and then collapsing into bed and sleeping and sleeping and sleeping... like a snuggled in fish...

careful on 6-6-06.

my eyeballs have had a hard day.  i read all morning and i'm goin' blind so that hurt.  then at work a puff of steam blasted my left eye.  on the way home, i got whammied by snail (snow-hail!  ouch!) and i just cut an onion up and i'm ever so sensitive to onion fumes.  i'd cry about it, but it would just hurt my eyes more.

i'm mentally composing a dating manifesta for myself.  so far the main points are that future partners must have 1) fantasticness 2) feminist values  3)healthy drinking habits .  i'm not going to date anyone anymore unless they are amazing individuals full of vim and vigor.  i can't decide to date someone, give up so much time and energy and love to someone just because they're nice.  most everyone i know is nice.  the feminist values part was suggested by my brilliant sister.  basically my entire world view is shaped by my ideas on gender and feminist politics.   if i'm dating someone who isn't overtly feminist, we probably won't be able to understand each other past a certain point or agree on how to run our relationship.  the drinking part is obvious.  shit ain't good for rylies to be around.  i've dated lovely beautiful people, but they have been alcoholics and/or pro-lifers and/or unfaithful.  this manifesta will hopefully help me to avoid some unsavory traits from here on out.  i feel good about this.  i'm holding out for that teenage feeling.

in other news:
all i want to do is sleep.

chai with fresh ginger all floatin' in it is good.  jalapeno cheese puffs are also good.  the two together?  not good.  but i want them both right now so i'm going for it.  i'm a gross person.  

john rose palermo dying is weird... my only interactions with him were pretty negative (he was a snob to me, i don't know why) but i always liked him anyway.  he just ran off a fuckin bridge mostly naked.  what are we supposed to make of that? when someone dies in a car accident or something, you can process it and heal and move on... but this?  was he secretly in a lot of pain all this time?  was he secretly crazy?  is everyone secretly crazy?  am i going to be in the paper sometime with quotes from aquiantences "she always seemed happy..."  no, no NO i am NOT going to be.  

fuckin a.

a while ago i drew up a "how to get your ass up to oly" financial plan.  in order for this move to happen this summer, i would have had to have been making mad cash for the past several months and spending basically nothing except like five bucks a week for rice and lentils.  at this rate, i will not be able to afford moving anywhere until 2009.     I'M GOING TO APPLY FOR ANOTHER JOB TOMORROW.  a friend said he'd reccomend me at another restaurant (i'd have to handle meat, though.  gross out), and another friend just got promoted at a plant nursery so maybe she could hook me up... TOMORROW RYLIE. 

i lost my voice a few days ago.  it's a strange experience.  today at work someone said "hey how's it goin'"  and i whispered back "just fine, how about you?"  and he looked at me and said "am i whispering, or are you?"  and it was FUNNY.  i have this really vivd memory of being a kid, curled up on the couch with my mom and sister, and being terrified because mom had lost her voice.  i thought it was a symptom of worse things to come, like first her voice would go and then her hair and then her ribcage and eventually mom would just be GONE.  in this same memory, we had just been robbed and dad was listing off all the stuff that had been stolen to the cops.  i wonder if these things happened simultaniously or if my memory is combining memories to save space for new memories.  do you remember these things marla?  i have a perfect image of you from those days in the brown house, swinging on that round swing with your whispy hair all full of sunshine.  I LOVE YOU SO!

all i want right now is for my cat to love me.  i'd settle for her even liking me.  or acknowledging my existence.  she is one grouchy creature.  the only time she shows even the remotest interest in me is when she's hungry.  and even then, she won't rub up against me or meow or anything.  she just sits about a yard away and blinks at me.  she had to have most of her teeth removed, but she doesn't like to eat wet food.  i'll set out some lovely soft, aromatic organic lamb entrails and she will refuse it, and then two seconds later eat an entire bowl of hard kibbles.  she swallows it whole.  she's fucking rugged.  she has these huge yellow-green eyes.  she stares a lot in a creepy kind of way.  she has long stripy-brown hair except for a white puff on her chest, white boots on her back legs and white slippers on her front legs.   a friend of mine found her at the pound.  when she came to live with me almost a year ago, she was covered in dreds which took a lot of time to get out, and she was so skinny you could feel her ribs, but she's finally gaining weight and actually has a belly growing.  she only has her four front teeth left, and her toungue sticks out a little most of the time. 

full name:
penelope the owl


nicknames:
penny
penpen
penini
neenee (said in a screechy high-pitched voice.  my personal favorite.)

likes:
none. 

dislikes:
me, mostly. 
baths, which she needs because she doesn't clean herself.  
the other cats.
the bed i made for her out of my down pillow and warm fuzzy blankets. 
taking medicine.

is coldly indifferent to:
everything else.  

basically, all she does is sleep curled up in the tiniest ball she can contort herself into, on top of a pile of clothes on the living room floor.  sometimes she sits in front of the little cat-sized water cooler and watches suspiciously as it bubbles and refills itself.  she is no fun.  she has no sense of humor.  she has sharp claws which she occasionally uses to make me bleed. 

i love her.  i wish she loved me back.

i just started reading hothead paisan, the homicidal lesbian terrorist.  i identify with this character more than pretty much any other character i've ever encountered.  she hangs out in her apartment all day drinking coffee, talking to her cat and being outraged with the shitty system we're all livin'. i'm not necessarily a lesbian, and i've never cut off a man's penis and thrown it in the garbage disposal, but still.  hothead and i are like peas and carrots.  in her ideal world, you don't lock your door or your bike.  everyone says hi to each other as they walk hand in hand with their best friends down the street.  gender is totally irrelevant and her cat is the goddamn president.  yes!  yes indeed-ee-doo!

i hate locking my bike up, and i hate locking my door.  it's this constant thing you have to do everyday that reminds you "you are not safe, others are not to be trusted, horde your things and while your at it, horde your ideas and heart and authentic self too."  i do not want to be cut off from my surroundings.  more than anything i want connection and reciprocity.  lately, however, i'm really getting more and more terrified of leaving my bedroom.  i don't want friends or loves or any other relationship where i'm vulnerable enough for someone to take a part of me away.  i keep getting hurt.  i don't want to keep having these heart breaks.  but i don't want to be hard and distant, either.   how confusing.  but like everything else, it's about finding a balance.  i guess i have to allow myself to be shut off right now and do a bit of healing before i can brave the world once more and share and experience and live.  let maude be my guide.  EL!  EYE!  VEE!  EE!  LIVE! 

thing is, i have never really found a space where i feel safe enough to express myself.  that's perhaps why i feel this pull towards olympia.  it's a clean slate, no expectations.  the trick is to start recognizing my patterns now, and analyzing them and breaking them so that when i get to this new clear city, i don't just fall into the same mindset that i'm in here.  

i wish therapy was free and accessible because i could really use some help with this.

currents.

shivering even though i'm wearing a sweater and mucklucks and running little cirlces in front of the heater .  

caffeinated even though it's past my bedtime.  coffee is warm.  if you put sugar in it, it is sweet.  sweet warm things are good to have.  

thinking of the henry miller museum in big sur.  my then-boyfriend and i stopped there on the fourth of july a few years ago.  he went in the the tiny little house-turned-museum but i boycotted because i don't like how henry miller treated women.  i sat in the sculpture garden instead and drank bad free coffee that a nice old hippy offered me.  after awhile michael and i went out back and found an enormous redwood log to climb on together in giddy quiet.  green filtered sunlight.  thick salty air.  dinosaur ferns and plops of dew falling from the branches far far above us.  we write letters to each other now.   i'm anais and he's henry. 

compulsively cleaning my house.  fuckin' sanitized and sparkling.  except my room.  i must be subconsciously building a nest because there are newspapers and clothes and blankets strewn all across my floor and i just sort of sit on it and walk on it instead of putting anything away.  now that i think about it, i've been bringing home twigs and dried flowers a lot lately.  whoa whoa WHOA.  i'm a bird forced to live a lady's life.  suddenly everything makes sense.  ornothology n'shit.  

considering what to do with the rest of my morning.  sleep is good.  staying up and going to get chilequiles as soon as they open is better.  staying up and going to get chilequiles with red sauce, not green, and lots of hot coffee is best.

LJ Interests meme results

  1. bikes:
    one of my bikes just got stolen. i'm bummed, for reasons twofold: first, there was a lot of emotional history wrapped up in that bike. my dad gave it to me when i moved to flag. secondly, i left it unlocked because i thought it would be safe and now a little bit of the trust i had for the people in my community is vanished off in stealy-land. shit man, it was a sweet ride.
  2. crushes:
    i've got one. on a boy. we're an odd couple for sure, but he's undeniably cute and kind to me and he makes me laugh. he pulls the covers up around my ears and kisses me on the temple when he leaves in the morning. swoon-a-rama. swoon-o-rama ding dang.
  3. found objects:
    last week i was walking on the urban trail and i found these papers someone had dropped. it was information a doctor had written out for someone named daniel about how to take care of his broken leg. i wondered to myself "what was broken-legged daniel doing walking around out here?"
  4. lists:
    why do i like lists? 1. best organizational tool known to humankind, hands down. 2. i can't remember things too good, so writting stuff down helps me. 2. it's genetic. my mother, and her mother before her, were list-makers. it's good to carry on my family heritage, i feel. 3. they are fun to find years later. just today i found an old to-do list that included vacuuming my room and losing five pounds. side note: FUCK LOSING FIVE POUNDS.
  5. my cats:
    the star of the show these days is milo, my roomie's cat. he's a biter. he's naughty. he likes to sleep under the covers with me. he likes to watch drippy faucets and the toilet. he's got love handles. shout outs to little mister fluffers, penini, bug, boji, zuuzuu and mr. man.
  6. peace and quiet:
    i don't really get enough of it lately... makes me grumpy.
  7. rock and roll:
    i really like devendra banhart's new album. i am totally in love with will oldham. and last night, i was amazed by mr. calvin johnson. his voice can fill a building without even trying.
  8. stargazing:
    have you ever stargazed in a mountain town in the wintertime? give it a try, it'll send the shivvers right on up your spine.
  9. tele-evangelism:
    i don't really watch tv much these days, but i used to love it. benny hinn, the weird lady with the wobbly voice in a fake living room, and of course mr. and mrs. crazy (the man with ugly-silk-shirt-covered man breasts and the lady with the wigs and eye lashes and fake breasts and also with the craziness. craziness.)
  10. vegetarianism:
    seven years and going strong. i did try some spicy tuna sushi awhile ago, but i'd rather have baked tofu or hummus any day. or avocado sandwiches or cereal with bananas sliced on top, or vegan molasses cookies or tomato soup with fresh basil or yams or refried beans.

strange realization:  the less secure with my body image i am, the more politically minded i become.  and angry.  because i know it ain't no natural inclination that i hate my body sometimes.  i know it ain't my fault i feel bad.  so i get pissed at cosmo magazine.  and every jerkass dude that looks at me in that "heeey..." kind of way, or any jerkass lady that looks at me like "yeah, i'm way cuter than you."  and i get pissed at condoleza rice.  and the gap.  and everything else that is man-made.  anger anger anger.  stabby stabby stabby.  

what's up with women not hangin' together?  wouldn't it be awesome if we all gave each other neck rubs when we were stressing, and brought each other tea when we were bleedin' and left secret surprises on each other's doorsteps?  wouldn't we all be stronger?  instead, we judge each other on the most unimportant things imaginable and talk shit and outcast one another from our little circles.  it sucks.  i want that to change in my life.


for my sociology class, i can write my paper on any subject that has anything to do with gender.  here are some of my ideas:
--alternatives to the gender binary
--body image issues and the differences between those of men and women
--female criminality
--anti-feminism

i'm having a hard time deciding because there's just so much to choose from and it's all amazingly interesting to me, so i need your help!   tell me which you think is the best, or give me more ideas.

even though i am really quite happpy in my little life right now, i'm thinking i should move to olympia.  maybe as soon as january.  i don't know anyone there.  i have never visited.  the whole idea came about because i want to attend evergreen university, but i doubt i could ever afford it.  so why go, when i have a home here, friends and familiar faces on the street, a sweetheart and my cats and a kick-ass job?  i don't know!  but i still think i should go!  i'm kinda dumb i think!  i like exclamation points!

on october 8th, a band called clap your hands and say yeah is playing somewhere in the metropolitan phoenix area.  i'm hoping to come down and see them, and they are awesomegood so maybe i'll see some of you there.  love to all, all, all of ya.

where's my cat?  she's missing and the last time i saw her she had some kind of infection in her mouth...  come on home now penny, we love you and i'll give you some tuna if you just come on home.

the salt river's beauty cannot be diminished even by hordes of asu frat boys and their drunk sorority friends.  i wanted to float on in my inner tube tied to the innertubes of friends and the cooler filled with SO MANY CHEAP BEERS for days and days, or until the river came to an end.  we slept in the desert and listened to coyotes make thier crazy barking-whining noises all night.  yeah, good times.

this morning i sat out in front of my coffeeshop for a few hours and talked to people who didn't have anyone to sit with either, so they just sat with me.  it was great.  i'm going to do that more often so i can eventually meet every single person who lives in flagstaff.  

my ceramics class is in half an hour.  WHEE!  my sociology class is going to be great, the professor seems to be a bad-ass kind of woman who expects nothing less than excellence from her students.  tomoorw's class is women in the criminal justice system and that along with starting up copwatch has some new ideas brewing up in my head about what i'd like to do with my life.  i'm happy to be back in school. i'm a-gonna learn so much my brains'll fall right on outta my ears.

williams arizona is the home of my pal hillary.  i like to call her hill, but she hates it so i only say it in my head.  i visit her family in williams sometimes because we all like each other.  i have a coffee date with her cousin.  i have good conversations with her brother.  williams is a train town, and you can hear old-timey whistles blowing all day long.  i like to wake up in this family's living room, where every wall is full of windows and the cat sounds like a rusty screen door opening.  i want to move here and refurbish one of these old houses.
